overview: Cancer nursing practice is characterised by a diversity of clinical presentations, requiring application of a core set of clinical skills in specialist nursing practice.

In this subject, students will apply the theoretical principles from this subject and the Applied Pathophysiology and Foundations in Cancer Nursing subjects to build competency in the application of core skills learned in the subject within the clinical area of their specialty practice. Students’ application of their learning will be also evaluated in the clinical setting. Students will demonstrate the ability to undertake comprehensive patient assessments, plan and deliver individualised, evidence-based, best practice specialist cancer nursing care to meet the range of supportive care needs of people affected by cancer.

necessary pre-requisite: Note: the following subject/s can also be taken concurrently (at the same time)
additional pre-requisite: Students are required to be employed in a cancer care setting as a Division 1 Registered Nurse and working a minimum of 24 hours per week

assessments.description: Formative written assessment (Professional Practice Portfolio Part A). 500 words (total). Hurdle requirement:. Students must pass this assessment.
assessments.timing: First half of the teaching period

assessments.description:
Summative written assessment 
(Professional Practice Portfolio Part B). 500 words. Hurdle requirement:. Students must pass this assessment.

Clinical Skills Assessments x 3 (500 words each)
(Professional Practice Portfolio Part C). 1500 words (equivalent). Hurdle requirement:. Students must pass all 3 clinical skill assessments.
assessments.timing: Distributed evenly across the study period and due by the end of assessment period.

April - Off Campus.Contact hours: 3 hours of webinars (three seminars in total) spread across the study period. Students are expected to commit 5 hours per-week to their online learning activities – including self-directed learning, individual activities, group activities, discussion boards and webinars.

April - Off Campus.Pre teaching requirements: Students will familiarise themselves with the online platform which will provide an overview of the subject, assessment requirements and expected activities and behaviours. They will also be provided with information about studying online and informed about the University resources available to them.

Prescribed texts: There is no prescribed text for this subject
